vision.notes: Adults and larvae are usually found in flowers, suggesting visual capability for locating flowers and prey. The ant-mimicking behavior of Franklinothrips may also rely on visual cues.

chemoreception.notes: Associated with flower location and host/prey detection, as many species feed on flowers and/or are predators.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely used for detecting prey and navigating their environment. Pupation on the ground suggests sensitivity to substrate vibrations.
